item.description:
Our Sangha will be heading to New York early this morning to join the New York Sangha for a special service to commemorate the 10th anniversary of 9/11 on Sunday the 11th. We will be visiting the Asia Society on Saturday to view a special exhibit of Buddhist Art from Pakistan. Enjoy the city that night and Sunday morning head to the New York Sangha to hold a service at there Temple followed by lunch then an Interfaith Service and lantern floating on the Hudson for 9/11. We will come back to Boston Sunday late evening. If you are interested please RSVP here then call Ryuoh Shonin so we can make hotel reservations and also figure out the carpool.

We will be staying in New Jersey and taking the Path train into New York. 

Cost will be hotel, your own food and gas money to the carpool cars. Hotel rooms can be shared for those wishing a smaller cost.

We may need carpool cars if we get several people. The ministers car can handle several five people and luggage.
item.name: To New York for Interfaith Service for 9/11 with New York Sangha
